intro: Ervilia monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered ervilia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows from a compact, low-growing rosette and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Ervilia monanthos is often found in rocky soils and is a common component of the vegetation in its native habitat.
